Act1Scene3.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Where hast thou been, sister?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Second Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Killing swine.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Third Witch
Act1Scene3.text: A drum, a drum! Macbeth doth come.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: So foul and fair a day I have not seen.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: How far is ’t called to Forres?—What are these, So withered, and so wild in their attire. You should be women, And yet your beards forbid me to interpret That you are so.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Speak if you can. What are you?

Act1Scene3.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3.text: All hail, Macbeth! Hail to thee, Thane of Glamis!

Act1Scene3.speaker: Second Witch
Act1Scene3.text: All hail, Macbeth! Hail to thee, Thane of Cawdor!

Act1Scene3.speaker: Third Witch
Act1Scene3.text: All hail, Macbeth, that shalt be king hereafter!

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: Good sir, My noble partner You greet with present grace and great prediction Of noble having and of royal hope, To me you speak not. If you can look into the seeds of time And say which grain will grow and which will not, Speak, then, to me, who neither beg nor fear Your favors nor your hate.

Act1Scene3.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Hail!

Act1Scene3.speaker: Second Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Hail!

Act1Scene3.speaker: Third Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Hail!

Act1Scene3.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Lesser than Macbeth and greater.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Second Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Not so happy, yet much happier.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Third Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Thou shalt get kings, though thou be none. So all hail, Macbeth and Banquo!

Act1Scene3.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3.text: Banquo and Macbeth, all hail!

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Stay, ell me more. By Sinel’s death I know I am Thane of Glamis. But how of Cawdor? The Thane of Cawdor lives.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: The earth hath bubbles, as the water has, And these are of them. Whither are they vanished?
Act1Scene3.translation: The Earth itself has bubbles, just like water, and they came from them. Whither are they vanished?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Into the air, and what seemed corporal melted.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: Have we eaten on the insane root That takes the reason prisoner?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Your children shall be kings.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: You shall be king.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: And Thane of Cawdor too. Went it not so?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act1Scene3.text: The King hath happily received, Macbeth, The news of thy success.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Angus
Act1Scene3.text: We are sent To give thee from our royal master thanks, Only to herald thee into his sight, Not pay thee.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Ross
Act1Scene3.text: And for an earnest of a greater honor, He bade me, from him, call thee Thane of Cawdor, In which addition, hail, most worthy thane, For it is thine.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: What, can the devil speak true?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: The Thane of Cawdor lives. Why do you dress me In borrowed robes?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Angus
Act1Scene3.text: Who was the Thane lives yet, But under heavy judgment bears that life Which he deserves to lose. treasons capital, confessed and proved, Have overthrown him.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Glamis and Thane of Cawdor! The greatest is behind. Do you not hope your children shall be kings, When those that gave the Thane of Cawdor to me Promised no less to them?

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: But ’tis strange. And oftentimes, to win us to our harm, The instruments of darkness tell us truths, Win us with honest trifles, to betray ’s In deepest consequence.—

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: If chance will have me king, why, chance may crown me Without my stir.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: Worthy Macbeth, we stay upon your leisure.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Give me your favor. Let us toward the King.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3.text: Very gladly.

Act1Scene3.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3.text: Till then, enough.—Come, friends.
